awd_abstract_narration:
The primary goal of the US Ignite is to break a fundamental deadlock: there is insufficient investment in gigabit applications that can take advantage of advanced network infrastructure because such infrastructure is rare and dispersed. And conversely, there is a lack of broad availability of advanced broadband infrastructure for open experimentation and innovation because there are few advanced applications and services to justify it.  US Ignite applications are focused on national priority areas of advanced manufacturing, clean energy and transportation, cyber learning, health IT, and public safety/emergency preparedness.  Many of the applications under development in this program build on NSF-funded advanced networking and computational infrastructure developed as part of the NSF GENI program.  All of the projects demonstrate the value of advanced networking.   This project supports the 2nd annual US Ignite Application Summit, an event which will demonstrate the next generation applications currently being developed, educate a broad community on the  potential for next-generation application capabilities and recruit cities and individuals for the next round of application development.

The Applications Summit is being held June 24-27, 2014, in Sunnyvale, CA.  This project supports academic and student participation in the Summit, and helps offset the costs of hosting the event and disseminating results.

US Ignite hosted the 2014 Application Summit on June 24 to 27, 2014 at the Juniper Aspiration Dome in Sunnyvale, California.  The event brought together 250 participants, and it is one of the only events to showcase dozens of live demonstrations of advanced networking public benefit applications. It brought together the developers, technologists, corporate labs and academic researchers interested in the unlimited potential of advanced technologies like symmetric gigabit, software defined networking (SDN) and local cloud with the organizations, municipalities, and government leaders who want to leverage these networks to address challenges faced in education, healthcare, transportation and more, yielding economic development and positive social outcomes.

The event’s purpose was two-fold: education and community building.  The Summit hosted keynote speakers, panel presentations, BarCamp-styled education sessions, and showcased 30 demonstrations of advanced networking public benefit applications. Juniper Networks hosted the event at its facilities, and a special event was hosted at the Computer History Museum.

The diverse group heard from communities with deployed advanced networks and gave participants a “first” look at the transformative power of next-generation technologies. These “firsts” were “things” that had not previously been demonstrated or seen before, such as:

  • First deployed virtualization demos
  • First gigabit wireless at a conference
  • First national demo of SightDeck for telehealth
  • First workshop and demo of super-locavore technology Paradrop
  • First demo of phone containers with secure connection to apps (SeaCAT)
  • Flying WiFi trunking to provide disaster coverage (Drone-Carried On-demand WiFi)
  • First coast-to-coast forensically-pulled RAM (Cyber Security as a Service)

The highlights were the 30 application demonstrations. To recognize the greatest achievements, US Ignite presented the following Summit awards:

1.         Best App in Show: Children’s Mercy Hospital with SightDeck, which provides interactive collaboration with video, voice and graphics from several locations all layered together, visually organized into a real size, real time, intuitive work platform.

2.         Best App in App Expo: Foresite Health Monitoring by ProactiveSense, an application that uses advanced monitoring technology to analyze in-depth data to accurately predict and prevent health issues such as: falls, heart problems, depression, strokes, respiratory problems, urinary tract infections and more.

3.         Best App in Health:  Fitnet, a telefitness application connecting fitness coaches to clients with on demand and real time collaboration.

4.         Best App in Energy:  Secure WAMS, which demonstrated cyber-security mechanisms for wide-area monitoring and control of next-generation power grids.

5.         Best App in Public Safety: Cyber Security as a Service, which provides effective digital forensic / cyber security techniques from across the country.

6.         Best App in Education: Augmented Reality for Improved Training of First Responders

7.         Most Likely to Have a Big Impact: Virtual World Framework, which provides an HTML5 based virtual world collaborative environment and virtual world construction environment.
